item.title: Kurdish P.K.K. Says It Will End Conflict with Turkish State
item.description: The Kurdistan Workers’ Party, or P.K.K., said that it would lay down its arms and disband, a decision that could reverberate in neighboring countries.

item.title: Pope Leo XIV Calls for News Media to Shun Divisive Language
item.description: In his first audience with the press as pontiff, Leo renewed his pleas for a more peaceful world and quoted his predecessor, Pope Francis, who had cal...

item.title: Pope Leo XIV Reiterates Call for Peace in First Address to Journalists
item.description: The first American pontiff also urged reporters to choose “the path of a communication of peace” in his first address to news media as the leader of t...

item.title: E.U. Leaders Demand Russia Accept Ukraine Cease-fire by End of Day
item.description: The Kremlin brushed off the threat of further sanctions, saying that “the language of ultimatums is unacceptable.”

item.title: Who Is Edan Alexander, the American Hostage Held by Hamas in Gaza?
item.description: Hamas said it would release the American Israeli national, who was serving in the Israeli Army when he was captured on Oct. 7, 2023.
